intro: Cocculus rotundifolius, commonly known as the devil's bit scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, round leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. It has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and produces small, round, green fruits that mature to a dark brown color. Cocculus rotundifolius is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
